verses.verse: "I have come <WH935> into my garden, <WH1588> my sister, <WH269> [my] bride; <WH3618> I have gathered <WH717> my myrrh <WH4753> along <WH5973> with my balsam. <WH1314> I have eaten <WH398> my honeycomb <WH3293> and my honey; <WH1706> I have drunk <WH8354> my wine <WH3196> and my milk. <WH2461> Eat, <WH398> friends; <WH7453> Drink <WH8354> and imbibe <WH7937> deeply, <WH7937> O lovers. <WH1730>"

"I was asleep, <WH3463> but my heart <WH3820> was awake. <WH5782> A voice! <WH6963> My beloved <WH1730> was knocking: <WH1849> 'Open <WH6605> to me, my sister, <WH269> my darling, <WH7474> My dove, <WH3123> my perfect <WH8535> one! <WH8535> For my head <WH7218> is drenched <WH4390> with dew, <WH2919> My locks <WH6977> with the damp <WH7447> of the night. <WH3915>'
"I have taken <WH6584> off <WH6584> my dress, <WH3801> How <WH9010> can I put <WH3847> it on [again?] I have washed <WH7364> my feet, <WH7272> How <WH9010> can I dirty <WH2936> them [again?]
"My beloved <WH1730> extended <WH7971> his hand <WH3027> through <WH4480> the opening, <WH2356> And my feelings <WH4578> were aroused <WH1993> for him.

"I arose <WH6965> to open <WH6605> to my beloved; <WH1730> And my hands <WH3027> dripped <WH5197> with myrrh, <WH4753> And my fingers <WH676> with liquid <WH5674> myrrh, <WH4753> On the handles <WH3709> of the bolt. <WH4514>

"I opened <WH6605> to my beloved, <WH1730> But my beloved <WH1730> had turned <WH2559> away <WH2559> [and] had gone! <WH5674> My heart <WH5315> went <WH3318> out [to him] as he spoke. <WH1696> I searched <WH1245> for him, but I did not find <WH4672> him; I called <WH7121> him, but he did not answer <WH6030> me.

"The watchmen who make <WH5437> the rounds <WH5437> in the city <WH5892> found <WH4672> me, They struck <WH5221> me [and] wounded <WH6481> me; The guardsmen <WH8104> of the walls <WH2346> took <WH5375> away my shawl <WH7289> from me.

"I adjure <WH7650> you, O daughters <WH1323> of Jerusalem, <WH3389> If <WH518> you find <WH4672> my beloved, <WH1730> As to what <WH4100> you will tell <WH5046> him: For I am lovesick. <WH2470> <WH160>"

"What <WH4100> kind of beloved <WH1730> is your beloved, <WH1730> O most beautiful <WH3303> among women <WH802>? What <WH4100> kind of beloved <WH1730> is your beloved, <WH1730> That thus <WH3602> you adjure <WH7650> us?"
"My beloved <WH1730> is dazzling <WH6703> and ruddy, <WH122> Outstanding <WH9082> among <WH4480> ten <WH7233> thousand. <WH7233>
"His head <WH7218> is [like] gold, <WH3800> pure <WH6337> gold; <WH6337> His locks <WH6977> are [like] clusters <WH8534> of dates, <WH8534> [And] black <WH7838> as a raven. <WH6158>
"His eyes <WH5869> are like doves, <WH3123> Beside <WH5921> streams <WH650> of water, <WH4325> Bathed <WH7364> in milk, <WH2461> [And] reposed <WH3427> in [their] setting. <WH4402>

"His cheeks <WH3895> are like a bed <WH6170> of balsam, <WH1314> Banks <WH4026> of sweet-scented herbs; <WH4840> His lips <WH8193> are lilies, <WH7799> Dripping <WH5197> with liquid <WH5674> myrrh. <WH4753>
"His hands <WH3027> are rods <WH1551> of gold <WH2091> Set <WH4390> with beryl; <WH8658> His abdomen <WH4578> is carved <WH6247> ivory <WH8127> Inlaid <WH5968> with sapphires. <WH5601>

"His legs <WH7785> are pillars <WH5982> of alabaster <WH9635> Set <WH3245> on pedestals <WH134> of pure <WH6337> gold; <WH6337> His appearance <WH4758> is like Lebanon, <WH3844> Choice <WH977> as the cedars. <WH730>

"His mouth <WH2441> is [full of] sweetness. <WH4477> And he is wholly <WH3605> desirable. <WH4261> This <WH2088> is my beloved <WH1730> and this <WH2088> is my friend, <WH7453> O daughters <WH1323> of Jerusalem. <WH3389>"
